identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Football/National Football League/New York Giants

abstract.p: New York Giants retire uniform of Frank Gifford, who still holds team records for career touchdowns, rushing average and receiving yards (S)

block.p: Frank Gifford, who still holds Giants records for career touchdowns, rushing average and receiving yards -- as well as remaining a symbol of great Giants years -- finally saw his number retired.
It happened at a dinner at Manhattan's ''21'' Club last week to celebrate almost half a century of Gifford's connection to the National Football League. He was the Giants' top draft pick of 1952.
Frank Gifford, who still holds Giants records for career touchdowns, rushing average and receiving yards -- as well as remaining a symbol of great Giants years -- finally saw his number retired.
It happened at a dinner at Manhattan's ''21'' Club last week to celebrate almost half a century of Gifford's connection to the National Football League. He was the Giants' top draft pick of 1952.

The Giants' co-owner, Wellington Mara, ended the dinner with a surprise announcement, holding up Gifford's famed No. 16 and telling him no one else would wear the jersey again. Gifford is the 11th Giant to have his number retired.
